sentences.sContent: Thee direct address of an absent or imaginary person or of a personified abstraction, especially as a digression in the course of a speech or composition.
sentences.sContent_eng: Thee direct address of an absent or imaginary person or of a personified abstraction, especially as a digression in the course of a speech or composition.
sentences.sCn: 呼语：直接称呼不在场或虚构的人物或称呼拟人的事物，尤指作为演讲或作文过程中的离题话。 。

sentences.sContent: In that speech in Alexandria, though, Nasser chose to delve back even further into history, in a long digression on the building of the Suez canal a century earlier.
sentences.sContent_eng: In that speech in Alexandria, though, Nasser chose to delve back even further into history, in a long digression on the building of the Suez canal a century earlier.
sentences.sCn: 但是，在亚历山大港的那次演说，纳赛尔选择的是远远的向回探究历史，离题很远地谈到了早在一个世纪之前苏伊士运河的修建。

sentences.sContent: After this digression we return now to our original problem.
sentences.sContent_eng: After this digression we return now to our original problem.
sentences.sCn: 在这一段插话以后，现在回到原来的问题。

remMethod.val: 大会 (congress) 讨论有些离题 (digression) 了
